attributes.action: The Mayor of London answer to Parliament over the ill considered CS5.
attributes.additional_details: The residents and other road users objections have not been listened to and the cycle lobby have been permitted undue and inappropriate influence in the promotion of this scheme along this route. Emergency vehicles are incapable of moving through and this will result in loss of life. London has been brought to a standstill on one of its most important thoroughfares.
attributes.background: The Mayor, has proceeded with the construction of CS5  into already heavily congested routes through which all forms of transport are forced to travel, whilst alternate routes are empty and unused. Justify the loss of income, increased pollution and danger to road users and residents of this scheme.

rejection.details:
The Mayor of London is responsible to the London Assembly and not to the UK Government or Parliament.

You may wish to submit a petition to the London Assembly calling for a response from the Mayor of London. Details of how to do this are available here: 
https://www.london.gov.uk/mayor-assembly/london-assembly/take-part/petitions
